snippet: Activists in Keene, N.H., are tracking parking officers, feeding expired meters and leaving notes saying “we saved you from the king’s tariff,” all in an effort to combat the “violent monopoly” of government.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column examines rising tensions in Keen, NH, where libertarian group Free State Project continues anti-government campaign that includes feeding parking meters to prevent police from issuing tickets; notes that group has incurred ire of locals and police as it seeks to relocate some 20,000 like-minded people from across country to carve out enclave that will be free of what they see as government tyranny.
lead_paragraph: Activists in Keene, N.H., are tracking parking officers, feeding expired meters and leaving notes saying “we saved you from the king’s tariff,” all in an effort to combat the “violent monopoly” of government.

headline.print_headline: Libertarians Trail Meter Readers, Telling Town: Live Free or Else
headline.main: Libertarians Trail Meter Readers, Telling Town: Live Free or Else
